Message.Title: Firing on All Cylinders...
Message.Msg: YHOO is killing it and this trend will only strengthen as we move forward in 2013. One or more of the next quarterly earnings releases is going to surprise everyone and a 20-30% pop won't surprise me at all. I expect we will close in on $25 by the time YHOO reports in Apr and from there who knows with the way the Asian assets are performing and the reinvention of the core business. Shorts must be blind or stupid (or both). Anyway, an excerpt from a SA article this am... "When it comes to internet companies to actually buy right now, we find ourselves liking very few. We do know that among the old line internet companies we prefer Yahoo (YHOO) and their CEO over other names such as AOL. Looking at the stable of brands, execution and the audience all point to a premier brand with Yahoo and the fact that they are willing to bide their time by having Google sell their ads until they can overhaul their own system shows shrewd business sense. They are maximizing profits today while also looking to the future to maximize profits as well. Turning around this behemoth has not been easy, but the speed with which the transformation has taken place has been stunning - especially when one considers how many tried before and failed. The company is a play on advertising revenue as well as a site creator via add-ons to its portal. Investors like the story here as the shares hit another 52-week high yesterday."

Topic.Title: Yahoo Signs Agreement to Use Google’s Services for Display Ads

Message.Msg: When it comes to internet companies to actually buy right now, we find ourselves liking very few. We do know that among the old line internet companies we prefer Yahoo (YHOO) and their CEO over other names such as AOL. Looking at the stable of brands, execution and the audience all point to a premier brand with Yahoo and the fact that they are willing to bide their time by having Google sell their ads until they can overhaul their own system shows shrewd business sense. They are maximizing profits today while also looking to the future to maximize profits as well. Turning around this behemoth has not been easy, but the speed with which the transformation has taken place has been stunning - especially when one considers how many tried before and failed. The company is a play on advertising revenue as well as a site creator via add-ons to its portal. Investors like the story here as the shares hit another 52-week high yesterday.

Topic.Title: talking ones book

Message.Msg: Thanks! My rational for Netflix or start something to destroy them was 09' maybe, so with Yahoo's time spent online falling to FB, how great would it be to have an online virtual movie theater? They could make a deal with Icahn's Lionsgate and offer movies for $1 or whatever. You get a minute or two of previews of which Yahoo sells ads and you got a movie on your PC, Ipad, smartphone or whatever. The cost to stream a movie for Netflix is less than a nickel, I believe. With an audience of half a billion or whatever it could be a cash cow. You'd attack Netflix and to a lesser extent Redbox if you can get current movies. My rational for LinkedIn, which has only exploded in value in the last month, is its a great place to network with the very top of a company, learn about any company and their career offerings and contribute to communities/groups you find interesting. They also added on the homepage articles from various business websites(BusinessInsider/Wall St. Journal etc.). 75-80% of HR finds people there and really no competitor. FB is aiming to launch something similar but I have my doubts as people go on FB for personal reasons not business and most people I know don't have their career on there. One I forgot to mention is I suggested Zynga, long before it went public, as Yahoo's Games section is embarrassingly behind graphically. Some of those games like Chess/Checkers/Solitaire/Poker had graphics from the late 90's.lol At the time, winter of 09', it was worth $1B-$2B and in a matter of weeks it was worth $5B.(I posted an article on it that December). That could have been a bad one when it fell to cash levels, a month or two ago, but its more than doubled so Yahoo would have been ahead. At some point all 3 looked dumb...NFLX splitting their DVD business and stock imploded, LinkedIn while rapidly growing is richly valued and Zynga, iffy business.

Topic.Title: Yahoo Bringing Alike Team Into Mobile Group

Message.Msg: Today, mobile app company Alike has announced that it has been acquired by Yahoo! and will be joining the Yahoo! Mobile team.

Topic.Title: Yahoo Bringing Alike Team Into Mobile Group

Message.Msg: Many have thought that Foursquare was a perfect acquisition target for Yahoo and that might still be the case, or the company decided that it liked the Alike app and team much better. At the very least, Yahoo now has a battle-tested social-experienced mobile team on its staff. Through a spokesperson, Yahoo has confirmed the acquisition but is not sharing the purchase price at this time.

Message.Title: No Dividend for Stockholders!!!!!!!!!
Message.Msg: Additionally, the company is committed to returning capital to its shareholders. Mayer had announced in the past that all proceeds of the Alibaba sale would be returned to shareholders. In Q4, Yahoo! had already spent $1.5 billion of those funds buying roughly 80 million YHOO shares. Since the company doesn't give dividends and has already effectively utilized its buyback strategy, it's safe to assume the remaining $1.5 billion or so will be spent the same way - through share buybacks, as opposed to initiating a dividend or even issuing a special dividend as some had hoped. This is a real disappointment for stockholders....as for me I have a sell at $25.

Message.Title: Yahoo to return Yahoo! Japan capital to Shareholders
Message.Msg: Mayer said, Yahoo Japan and Alibaba were tremendous investments that the company made, they're a little different. Yahoo Japan is in many ways more strategic for us, they're terrific investments, I really need to give kudos to the founders of Yahoo. But, overall, these investments, we're cognisant of them, we have an obligation to manage them well, and ultimately to return capital. We're now returning 85% of the proceeds of the Alibaba transaction to shareholders.

Message.Title: Yahoo CEO says Yahoo Japan is "strategic"
Message.Msg: Yahoo Inc Chief Executive Marissa Mayer said on Tuesday that Yahoo Japan is "strategic" to the company. Mayer was speaking at the Goldman Sachs technology conference in San Francisco. Q: On Yahoo Japan, what's holding you back from selling? Mayer: The key piece here, is that we think it's an appreciating asset for one. Moreso, it is strategic for us, we are an advertising company and an Internet company. One of the challnges is, we are primarily domestic, and we don't have enough of our business running from an international basis. There are a couple markets that are key: The UK, German, and Japan is clearly one of them. It's such a rich market overall in terms of advertising. Yahoo Japan is really how we do that. A lot of the technology that Yahoo Japan is built on is in fact our technology. They bascially run somewhere in the order of 7 to 8 of the top 10 properties in Japan.

Topic.Title: Yahoo CFO Ken Goldman to join Yahoo! Japan board

I agree at this point no one cares about what he said back in '42, those days are gone time to move on. Like I said in another post anyone with an oz of brains could figure out that after Marissa came in this was going to go up, Didn't take some clown and his 42 aliases to figure that out. I also looked at HP and what Meg might do and it was Marissa and Yahooo hands down. Bought a ton of Yahoo and never even knew coldone existed until after I bought and came to this board. So I made some good money off this stock without even knowing he existed. As far as I am concerned he doesn't exist. Ignore is your friend

Topic.Title: Another thing very interesting...

Message.Msg: what does that mean. Thanks

Message.Title: Marissa Mayer says Microsoft search deal underperforms
Message.Msg: SAN FRANCISCO (Reuters) - Yahoo Inc Chief Executive Marissa Mayer said the company's search partnership with Microsoft Corp was not delivering the market share gains or the revenue boost that it should. "One of the points of the alliance is that we collectively want to grow share rather than just trading share with each other," Mayer said at the Goldman Sachs Technology and Internet Conference in San Francisco on Tuesday.

Topic.Title: Another thing very interesting...

Message.Msg: just what the words say, markets mo to size, like cheeze moves to a mouse, like metal moves to a magnet, --big bid or big offer, price will gravitate toward that price. btw, that was taught in markets 101! keep up your good work, do not get discouraged.

Topic.Title: Yahoo is Saying and Doing ALL The Right Things...

Message.Msg: wow, what a stupid post. Anyway, yeah, $50 - you heard it right. 3 earnings releases between now and then, Alibaba IPO (which is going to far exceed already lofty expectations), Yahoo Japan explosion, strategic alliances with the big players, etc. Need I go on? Throw in the constant reality of being acquired by a major player and yeah, 50 by the end of Jan 2014... Believe what you want my friend..

Topic.Title: Yahoo to return Yahoo! Japan capital to Shareholders

Message.Msg: return to share holders through shares buy back. Yes, Jerry and Dan did a great job in buying Alibaba and Yahoo Japan. They also lay down the foundation for Yahoo being the only dominant internet property that brings TV/Movie entertainment directly linked to this dominant internet portal.

Topic.Title: Marissa Mayer says Microsoft search deal underperforms

Message.Msg: Mayer acknowledged Microsoft is trying to improve the lagging search results but continues to come up short. Mayer has better options than Microsoft, hence the deal with Google. The Google partnership will grow until Mayer doesn't need it anymore. What a difference a good CEO makes.

Message.Title: Is Yahoo Overbought?
Message.Msg: Time to take a rest and form a new base. Looks like YHOO is over extended and the fatigue shows on today's chart. The weekly charts shows the upper Bollinger band at $21.84, so may see a run at that number and fall back.
